dc:oaiDcType.dc:title: Data and Code for: Impacts of Performance Pay for Hospitals: The Readmissions Reduction Program
dc:oaiDcType.dc:creator: atul gupta
dc:oaiDcType.dc:description: US policy increasingly ties payments for providers to performance on quality measures, though little empirical evidence guides the design of such incentives. I deploy  administrative data to study a large federal program that penalizes hospitals with high readmissions rates. Using policy-driven variation in the penalty incentive across hospitals for identi cation, I nd that hospital responses to the penalty account for two-thirds of the observed decrease in readmissions over this period, as well as a decrease in heart at-tack mortality. Quality improvement accounts for about half of the decrease in readmissions; the remainder is explained by selective admission of returning patients.
dc:oaiDcType.dc:subject: instrumental variable
differences in differences
hospital readmissions
performance pay
Medicare
H00 Public Economics: General
I10 Health: General
dc:oaiDcType.dc:source:
Primary data files are confidential and cannot be shared. These were obtained from:
1. Medicare claims - Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, 2006-14.
2. Hospital survey data - American Hospital Association annual surveys, 2006-14.

Public data files used in analysis are included in the packet: 

CMS PUBLIC FILES:
----------------
1. hospital_general_info - General hospital information like medicare provider id, name, zip, owner type, etc. Current version can be downloaded from https://data.medicare.gov/Hospital-Compare/Hospital-General-Information/xubh-q36u

2. hvbp-* - two files containing hospital penalty scores under the Hospital Value Based Purchasing program for FY2014. These files were downloaded from https://www.cms.gov/Medicare/Quality-Initiatives-Patient-Assessment-Instruments/HospitalQualityInits...

3. process_of_care_2007 - 2014 - files from CMS Hospital Compare containing process of care scores. These files were downloaded from https://data.medicare.gov/data/archives/hospital-compare

4. rsrr_by_condition_* - files from CMS containing hospital readmission rates (observed and risk adjusted) and penalty rates under HRRP. These files were downloaded from https://data.medicare.gov/data/archives/hospital-compare. Alternate versions available at https://data.nber.org/cms/readmissions/.

5. hosplist-2006:2015        - General information on hospitals recorded in CMS data;
Extracted from CMS hospital compare files for respective years from https://data.medicare.gov/data/archives/hospital-compare;


CROSS WALK FILES:
----------------
6. hosp_hsa_hrr_2007 - crosswalk file from the Dartmouth atlas to bring in hospital HRR information. Current version can be downloaded from https://atlasdata.dartmouth.edu/downloads/supplemental#hospital.

7. ICD9 to CCS cross walk files - files from AHRQ. can be downloaded from NBER: https://data.nber.org/ahrq/ccs/

8. ICD9 to CC cross walk files -- needed to generate risk indicators used by CMS in adjusting readmissions for risk. Downloaded from https://www.qualitynet.org/inpatient/measures/readmission/resources#tab4

9. hosp10:14        - General information on hospitals, and crosswalk to hrr; 2010-14;
Downloaded "Hospital tracking files" from https://atlasdata.dartmouth.edu/downloads/supplemental#crosswalks

10. ssa_fips_state_county2011 - State to county FIPS code/name crosswalk;              Downloaded from https://data.nber.org/ssa-fips-state-county-crosswalk/2011/ 

11. ZipHsaHrr10      - Zip code to HRR crosswalk; Downloaded from https://atlasdata.dartmouth.edu/downloads/geography/ZipHsaHrr10.xls;


ECONOMIC FACTOR CONTROLS: 
-------------------------------------
12. saipe-county-poverty-income - Data on county-level poverty rate, median hh income from Small Area Income & Poverty Estimates program of the US Census; Create using interactive tool at https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/saipe/data/tools.html.;

13. state-insurance-1999-12-cps - Data from the CPS on state level medicaid and uninsurance share of population for people under 65; Downloaded from https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/demo/tables/health-insurance/time-series/hib/hihistt6b.xls;

14. state-insurance-2008-17-acs - Data from the ACS on state level medicaid and uninsurance share of population for people under 65; Downloaded from https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/demo/tables/health-insurance/time-series/acs/hic06_acs.xlsx;

15. laucnty06:15        - Data from the Bureau of Labor Services unemployment series (LAU); Created using interactive tool at https://www.bls.gov/lau/data.htm

16. cpiu-2005-2016        - Data from BLS CPIU series used to deflate spending to 2016 dollars; Available at https://www.bls.gov/cpi/data.htm;
